title: Can the next champion have some anti-mobility?
body:
Like, I want a champion, preferably a jungler but I honestly don't care what role (except adc, fuck those guys in general, except Varus and MF, they don't have fucktons of mobility for no reason), anyways, a champion who is designed to fuck your mobility. I'm talking about Nasus Wither, Shen Taunt, Olaf ult, + Yi ult at the same time, Skarner ult (or any suppress in general) all in one kit. I just want a champion that punishes all this fucking mobility Riot is shoving in every champ. I swear since Vel'Koz Riot has decided every champion must have more mobility than the next. No seriously, think about it.

{{champion:161}}: No mobility.
{{champion:201}}: Can dash only to allies, not including wards.
{{champion:150}}: Spammable slow with jump that increases if it hits a target (not including wards).
{{champion:268}}: Free harass invulnerable units you can dash to, who can also dash themselves to increase your dash to them.
{{champion:429}}: Vayne Q on every auto. Free ward. Ability to FORCE a teammate to you (they have no say in taking Black Spear and no say in when they get pulled to you. Legit, I have been binded by so many Kalistas as jungle that jsut pull you so they can take a fucking kill from you. Seriosuly, fuck this champion in every aspect).
{{champion:421}}: System of 10 minute lasting reusable tunnels which you can tp to. This is the only champion who breaks the rule of "Give more mobility than the last."

Judging by this the next champion will most likely have a 2 second cooldown manaless Kassadin ult (but it won't do damage so it will totally be balanced) and a point and click ranged execute, along with their ultimate allowing them to instantly be anywhere on the map and invulnerable for 10 seconds while there.

You mean, like a slow? What 95% of the current champions already have? haha.
Mobility counters slows. Look Kalista. She's literally immune to slows as long as an enemy is nearby. And if no enemy is nearby, then slow wouldn't be a problem.

Really, do mobility champions even care if they're slowed? Zed can still blink back to his shadow, Lee Sin can still ward-hop over the wall, Leblanc can do the same as Lee but twice...

Slows actually hurt immobile champions more than mobile ones because, in general, they only slow normal walking speed.

Why do you think knockup has been so heavily picked?

On TOP of all that, it is also NOT reduced by tenacity! OP.
the old chilling smite kinda helped with that, now they nerfed that too...

If they manage to somehow release a champion with more mobility than Kalista, we can all uninstall LoL and go back to the original DotA mod.

I actually think a melee champion with a root could be pretty cool.  There are a few (Nautilus, Leona, Maokai) but most roots are ranged.  Perhaps an ability that roots all enemies within a small radius?  Short-ranged, so you still have to close to use it, but the ability to lock down multiple enemies could be very cool.
{{champion:32}} I thought you'd never pick me!
soraka equinox?{{champion:16}}
Something like that, but melee range.  My thought was actually similar to Randuin's active or Malphite's E - a small radius around the champ.

I want a champ with a skill that deals damage over time based on how much the target moves, including dashes/blinks/etc. Something like "[X] places a mark on the target, dealing 40/60/80/100/120 [+.4 AP] magic damage over 4 seconds. If the target moves during the duration, the mark flares up, dealing an additional 8/16/24/32/40 [+.08AP] magic damage for every 100 units moved. (Maximum 10 times) So if the target stays still or moves only a little, then they just take a little DoT. But if you tag an ulting Ahri with it, it's going to ruin her day. The 10 proc limit is so you don't instakill an ulting TF/Noct/Panth/etc.

That wouldn't be good. That would be Riot's philosophy of "Burden of Knowledge", which there was a DoTA2 champion who had a spell that dealt damage as you moved. They said it would be bad for new players to not understand it until they read the ability. But then again...

Isn't the solution to an enemy with robust mobility ({{champion:238}}) wards, map awareness, and communication? 
In the LCS a bunch of teams can manage to keep mobile champs down by paying attention to where they are at. I think the problem isn't in the champions (and this is going to sound rude) but it's the Summoners who can't figure out how to fight the champs, lose a game, and then hit up the boards and demand nerfs to the enemies they couldn't manage to beat.

And all of them have CC to wipe out all want to chase...

I think that the reason that it ended up being impossible to refuse Kalista's pact was because it would negate half of her kit if her support didn't accept it. OTOH, it can be annoying.

Easy, just have point-and-click snares, or maybe a brief snare-on-hit every 3 attacks or something. Or a form of CC which disables movement-abilities while not disabling attacks or movement (like how blind only disables AAs).

Or have a bleed effect that does more damage the faster/further the target moves?

There are a lot of ideas Riot could consider, they just have to do so.

Maybe a champ with something similar to the Diana pull move, but instead of pulling it just momentarily interrupts everything in an AoE (0.5s knockup). Have this on a low cooldown and you can basically use it to stop all dashes/channels.

Azir has pretty good antimobility, and low mobility himself. A dash to a soldier that you have to place and which subtracts from your DPS is not high mobility.

Gnar has very bad mobility in megagnar form, and his mobility in minignar form is gated hard by requiring something to bounce off of plus a high cooldown. And also is needed because of his short range.

Seriously though. Azir has both a (very short) knockup, and a literal wall of antimobility. Also who has antimobility: Anyone with a knockup. Knockups cancel dashes! Thresh, for example, is heavily CC oriented and has many tools to counter mobility, while having very low or gated mobiity himself.

Vi: Chargable and jukable mobility. Except for her ult. Which is one of the best antimobility tools in the entire game.

Lissandra: Gated and jukable mobility in her E, yes, but high cooldown. Also: Instant targetted CC, instant AoE CC, and a slow. Anti-mobility!

Really, CC is your answer there. Also: RIGHTEOUS GLORY: Anti-mobility, now in a convienent item format IMO. Really underappreciated.
